original_text:
Money Train Origins Dream Drop
La slot Money Train Origins Dream Drop del provider Relax Gaming è un gioco ricco di Bonus, paylines e una vincita potenziale pari a 10.000x la puntata!
Un tuffo nel passato
Nel corso del tempo la Relax Gaming ha rilasciato una serie di slot che hanno come protagonisti un treno e personaggi provenienti dal selvaggio West. Dopo il primo capitolo, ambientato nel XIX secolo in Mississippi o giù di lì, ha dotato gli altri episodi di venature steampunk, creando giochi futuristici ma senza mai dimenticare il tema principale. Con Money Train Origins Dream Drop si torna alle origini, come in un ipotetico cerchio che si chiude.
Appena carichiamo il gioco ci vengono presentati i personaggi e l’ambientazione, come fossimo di fronte ad un film di animazione e non ad una slot.
La griglia di gioco è sistemata nel vagone di un convoglio dalle cui feritoie fuoriescono fucili, colt e mitra, i simboli hanno una definizione molto alta. I semi delle carte da gioco, ad esempio, sembrano in rilievo grazie alle ombreggiature e alle differenze delle tonalità dei colori.
Caratteristiche del gioco
La Relax Gaming ha optato per una griglia di gioco classica, con 5 rulli e 4 righe su cui dimorano 40 linee di pagamento fisse. La scommessa parte da 0,20 moneti virtuali e si può arrivare a vincere una cifra pari a 10.000 volte la puntata. Tra le opzioni di gioco troviamo il tasto Quick Spin che serve per velocizzare la caduta dei simboli, e il pulsante Autoplay, con cui impostare da 5 a 1.000 giri automatici.
La volatilità è alta, il ritorno teorico al giocatore (RTP) è invece bassino, essendo pari al 94%.
Come vincere a Money Train Origins Dream Drop
Scopo del gioco è naturalmente quello di associare il maggior numero di simboli identici su una linea di pagamento attiva. Per quel che riguarda i simboli base, ne abbiamo 8 suddivisi equamente tra quelli di alto valore e quelli di basso valore. Al primo gruppo appartengono i semi delle carte da gioco, ossia quadri, fiori, cuori e picche. Ben più remunerativi sono i simboli appartenenti al secondo gruppo, rappresentati dai quattro personaggi. Per conoscere in modo chiaro il valore di ognuno di essi, consigliamo di dare un’occhiata alla tabella dei payments che si trova all’all’interno del menù.
La colt è il nostro Wild e ricopre una funzione davvero speciale perché oltre a sostituire tutti i simboli eccetto gli Scatter, ripaga quanto il simbolo di maggior valore.
Il primo Bonus che incontriamo è il Dream Drop, introdotto dalla dinamite che esplode. Sulla griglia vedremo atterrare solo simboli dorati DD, ma potrebbero arrivare anche balle di fieno. In tal caso la funzione non si attiva. Una volta che la griglia è piena, ci basterà cliccare sui simboli per scoprire il jackpot. Trovandone tre identici, la somma viene incassata.
La cassaforte è un altro simbolo Bonus e quando sui rulli ne atterrano 3, ricompensano con altrettanti Respins che si riattivano ad ogni simbolo speciale. Riempiendo una colonna con un simbolo speciale, viene aggiunto un rullo.
Ecco i simboli extra che possono atterrare:

Bonus Symbol: si tratta di un moltiplicatore compreso tra 1x e 10x
Collector: Si appropria del valore di tutti i simboli presenti in quel momento e li aggiunge al suo valore
Payer: applica un moltiplicatore a tutti i simboli
Banker: offre un moltiplicatore che si applica a tutti i simboli presenti e a quelli che atterreranno nei giri successivi
Healer: fa sì che i simboli rimangano sui rulli per il numero di Spin indicato dal simbolo
Persistent Collector: riscuote tutti i premi e li somma al termine del giro in corso e nei successivi
Persistent Payer: Svela un moltiplicatore e lo aggiunge ai simboli presenti e a quelli che atterreranno in seguito

Se si riempiono tutte le posizione senza sfruttare l’Healer si vince un premio pari a 1.000x la puntata!

Domande Frequenti 
Qual è la volatilità?

In Money Train Origins Dream Drop la volatilità è alta



Quante linee di pagamento ci sono?

Le paylines sono 40 e fisse



Qual è la vincita massima di Money Train Origins Dream Drop?

La somma massima che si può ottenere è pari a 10.000 volte la scommessa

raw_translation.response:
Money Train Origins Dream Drop Review

The Money Train Origins Dream Drop slot game from provider Relax Gaming is a game rich in bonuses, paylines, and a potential win of up to 10,000x your bet! 

A trip to the past

Over time, Relax Gaming has released a series of slots featuring a train and characters from the Wild West. After the first chapter, set in the 19th century in Mississippi or thereabouts, the other episodes were infused with steampunk veins, creating futuristic games but never forgetting the main theme. With Money Train Origins Dream Drop, we go back to the origins, like in a hypothetical circle that closes. 

As soon as we load the game, we are presented with the characters and the setting, as if we were in front of an animated film and not a slot. 

The game grid is set in a train car from which rifles, knives, and guns protrude from the slots, and the symbols have a very high definition. For example, the playing card suits seem to be in relief thanks to shading and color differences. 

Game features

Relax Gaming has opted for a classic game grid with 5 reels and 4 rows on which 40 fixed paylines reside. The bet starts at 0.20 virtual coins, and you can win a sum equal to 10,000 times your bet. Among the game options, we find the Quick Spin button, which speeds up the fall of the symbols, and the Autoplay button, which allows you to set from 5 to 1,000 automatic spins. 

The volatility is high, while the theoretical return to player (RTP) is quite low, being equal to 94%. 

How to win at Money Train Origins Dream Drop

The aim of the game is naturally to match as many identical symbols as possible on an active payline. As for the basic symbols, there are 8 divided equally between high and low-value ones. The first group includes the playing card suits, namely diamonds, clubs, hearts, and spades. More remunerative are the symbols belonging to the second group, represented by the four characters. To clearly know the value of each of them, we recommend taking a look at the payments table found within the menu. 

The knife is our Wild and has a truly special function because, in addition to replacing all symbols except the Scatter, it pays out as much as the highest value symbol. 

The first Bonus we encounter is the Dream Drop, introduced by the exploding dynamite. On the grid, we will only see golden DD symbols land, but hay bales may also arrive. In that case, the function is not activated. Once the grid is full, all we have to do is click on the symbols to reveal the jackpot. If you find three identical ones, the sum is paid out. 

The safe is another Bonus symbol, and when three of them land on the reels, they reward with as many respins that are reactivated with each special symbol. Filling a column with a special symbol adds a reel. 

Here are the extra symbols that can land: 

Bonus Symbol: It's a multiplier ranging from 1x to 10x 
Collector: It appropriates the value of all the symbols present at that moment and adds it to its value 
Payer: Applies a multiplier to all symbols 
Banker: Offers a multiplier that applies to all present and future symbols 
Healer: Ensures that the symbols remain on the reels for the number of spins indicated by the symbol 
Persistent Collector: Collects all prizes and adds them at the end of the current spin and in future ones 
Persistent Payer: Reveals a multiplier and adds it to present and future symbols.

If all positions are filled without using the Healer, you win a prize equal to 1,000x your bet! 

FAQs.

Review: Money Train Origins Dream Drop Review

The Money Train Origins Dream Drop slot game from provider Relax Gaming is a game rich in bonuses, paylines, and a potential win of up to 10,000x your bet! 

A trip to the past

Over time, Relax Gaming has released a series of slots featuring a train and characters from the Wild West. After the first chapter, set in the 19th century in Mississippi or thereabouts, the other episodes were infused with steampunk veins, creating futuristic games but never forgetting the main theme. With Money Train Origins Dream Drop, we go back to the origins, like in a hypothetical circle that closes. 

As soon as we load the game, we are presented with the characters and the setting, as if we were in front of an animated film and not a slot. 

The game grid is set in a train car from which rifles, knives, and guns protrude from the slots, and the symbols have a very high definition. For example, the playing card suits seem to be in relief thanks to shading and color differences. 

Game features

Relax Gaming has opted for a classic game grid with 5 reels and 4 rows on which 40 fixed paylines reside. The bet starts at 0.20 virtual coins, and you can win a sum equal to 10,000 times your bet. Among the game options, we find the Quick Spin button, which speeds up the fall of the symbols, and the Autoplay button, which allows you to set from 5 to 1,000 automatic spins. 

The volatility is high, while the theoretical return to player (RTP) is quite low, being equal to 94%. 

How to win at Money Train Origins Dream Drop

The aim of the game is naturally to match as many identical symbols as possible on an active payline. As for the basic symbols, there are 8 divided equally between high and low-value ones. The first group includes the playing card suits, namely diamonds, clubs, hearts, and spades. More remunerative are the symbols belonging to the second group, represented by the four characters. To clearly know the value of each of them, we recommend taking a look at the payments table found within the menu. 

The knife is our Wild and has a truly special function because, in addition to replacing all symbols except the Scatter, it pays out as much as the highest value symbol. 

The first Bonus we encounter is the Dream Drop, introduced by the exploding dynamite. On the grid, we will only see golden DD symbols land, but hay bales may also arrive. In that case, the function is not activated. Once the grid is full, all we have to do is click on the symbols to reveal the jackpot. If you find three identical ones, the sum is paid out. 

The safe is another Bonus symbol, and when three of them land on the reels, they reward with as many respins that are reactivated with each special symbol. Filling a column with a special symbol adds a reel. 

Here are the extra symbols that can land: 

Bonus Symbol: It's a multiplier ranging from 1x to 10x 
Collector: It appropriates the value of all the symbols present at that moment and adds it to its value 
Payer: Applies a multiplier to all symbols 
Banker: Offers a multiplier that applies to all present and future symbols 
Healer: Ensures that the symbols remain on the reels for the number of spins indicated by the symbol 
Persistent Collector: Collects all prizes and adds them at the end of the current spin and in future ones 
Persistent Payer: Reveals a multiplier and adds it to present and future symbols.

If all positions are filled without using the Healer, you win a prize equal to 1,000x your bet! 

FAQs.
